alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 08 at 3:10PM PST until December 09 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH TONIGHT OVER MOST MOUNTAINS OF SANTA BARBARA COUNTY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON OVER MOST OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... .Moderate to strong north to northeast winds combined with low relative humidities will elevate the risk for extreme fire behavior if a new fire starts. The winds and risk will be focused over Santa Barbara County through tonight Friday, then shift to Los Angeles and Ventura Counties on Saturday and Sunday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST SATURDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MOST MOUNTAINS OF SANTA BARBARA COUNTY... * WINDS...North to northeast winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph. Strongest in the mountains and foothills. Isolated gusts to 60 mph possible in the windiest locations. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimums 5 to 15 percent common. Poor overnight recoveries of 20 to 40 percent, possibly lower in some locations. * IMPACTS...If fire ignition occurs, conditions may be favorable for extreme fire behavior which would threaten life and property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While the Santa Barbara South Coast and Santa Ynez Valley is not included in this Red Flag Warning, residents should stay alert as winds could push any new fire starts toward the coast.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range
